intro: Pocockia kotschyi, commonly known as the desert stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that store water, allowing it to survive in dry environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in spring. Its compact growth habit and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Pocockia kotschyi is also notable for its ability to propagate through both seeds and vegetative means.
